definitions.definition: an offer by a person or a company to pay a particular amount of money for something

examples.text: A German firm launched a **takeover bid** for the company.
At the auction *(= a public sale where things are sold to the person who offers the most)*, the highest bid for the picture was £200.
the highest bid on the picture
I placed a bid on a repossessed Ferrari.
He made a cash bid for the company.
They have invited bids for the property.
They blocked a $24 million bid by a rival company.

definitions.definition: an offer to do work or provide a service for a particular price, in competition with other companies, etc.

examples.text: The company submitted a bid for the contract to clean the hospital.

definitions.definition: an effort to do something or to obtain something
definitions.sensetop: bid for somethingbid to do something

examples.text: a desperate bid to escape from his attackers
He attacked his guards in a desperate bid for freedom.
This play was her last bid for recognition.
It was a bid by the president to boost his popularity.
They failed in their bid to buy the company.

definitions.definition: a statement of the number of points a player thinks they will win
